element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm calculates an accumulated cost surface from an unitary cost layer, assuming that the cost is anisotropic (the cost of crossing each cell is not the same one in all directions). The value in each result cell is the cost up to the closest destination point.

element.name: COST
element.text: Values in this layer represent the cost of crossing each cell in the maximum cost direction

element.name: COSTDIR
element.text: Values in this layer represents the direction of maximum cost in degrees, counting clockwise from north.

element.name: FEATURES
element.text: Destination points are represented as cells with any valid value. Remaining cells must have the no-data value.

element.name: KFACTOR
element.text: The constant K in the following equation controls the way in which, from the maximum cost value (Fs) and the direction of maximum cost, the cost of moving in any other direction is computed.

element.name: ACCCOST
element.text: The accumulated cost surface, containing the cost of moving to the closest destination point.

element.name: CLOSESTPOINT
element.text: The values in this layer indicate the number that identifies the closest point. Cells with the same values in this layer have the same destination point as their closest one.
